intro: Pimelea bowmanni, commonly known as the Bowmann's bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, brush-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in heathland and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, woody fruits. Pimelea bowmanni is an important component of the local flora and is often found in coastal and inland regions.
